title: @Riot Meddler I get that the PBE cycle isn't done but we are getting Vayne and twitch nerfs right?
body:
It would be a really sick joke to make us have to play with Vayne 2 shotting everyone in the game after two items based on RNG and Twitch destroying whole teams.

I really want to have faith but i'm getting worried when all i'm seeing is Malz getting put in the trash and Shyvana buffs.

I really really really would appreciate it if you would nerf Vayne in particular since she is 10000x more frusterating to play against since idk if i can deal with another whole patch of Vayne dominance especially with a BOTRK buff on top of that.

replies.body:
Twitch is a product of the Meta.

Tanks with CoC and Teamfighting have become very prominent with most supports being peel supports that can protect someone just as Twitch.
Assassin's are being countered by the prominence of those two things; Peel and Tanks while Mid game spikes have become very important.

Thus Twitch has become one of the best ADC's, though I wouldn't call him overpowered in the slightest.

He still is squishy, lacks Peel like Vayne, has not mobility, no stealth and needs perfect setup to do his thing.
Agree completley. Twitch's kit is far better designed (i.e. not overloaded) he has a lot more counterplay.

To you two:
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

Twitch isn't a product of the meta.  He's a product of his W getting a humongous buff and being gifted an excellent lane phase and wave clear over night.  An area where he used to struggle (by design) he now excells in. And don't get me started on his new Q Delay timing,  it does more than just give him quicker camo,  it gives him more and faster burst windows in prolonged fights.  His win rate is top 5 at all minute checkmarks on Champion.gg.  His mini rework gave him new power,  and that's fine,  but he's a boss in any meta in his current state and needs a second look. 

And this is coming from someone who loves Twitch and his design,  pre and post rework.

Wp Meddler!

Patch 6.23 is locked for new changes at this point. A combination of non balance pre-season follow up, MMR issues making balance assessments trickier than usual and shifted patch dev cycles due to Thanksgiving means it's going to be a lighter patch than most balance wise.

We are talking about whether we should make changes to Vayne in 6.24 (the patch we're working on now), given she does look pretty strong. Twitch isn't currently on our radar, though possible that could change. Other stuff we'll likely be looking at includes Courage of the Colossus, Fervor, overall increase in magic damage from Aegis removal, Syndra, Fiddlesticks and more.
How's Ahri these days?

Quite strong in regular play. Some of that reflects that most mages have become significantly more effective after the Aegis change though and some of it's that a lot of people are still learning the assassin changes so mages often get easy match ups mid right now. Would want to address class as a whole issues/let the meta settle before considering balance changes for most mages as a result. Some outliers we'll touch in the meantime though (e.g. Syndra)

What about our supreme emperor? {{champion:268}}  Anything specific?
Trying to find some small love for him that helps out a little without recreating previous problems. Hopefully for 6.24 or 7.1. Tough to work on without making more fundamental changes.

Personally I won't play Azir until you let his Soldiers apply on-hit effects, even at a weakened value :)

The fact his soldiers can't apply red irks me.
Fiddlesticks?
Jungle changes have probably hit him too hard - Dark Wind's good at camps of 2-3, much weaker against camps of 1 or 6.
How about making his wind bounce back to him like old Ryze's spell flux?

that would be way too strong and would probably turn him into a ridiculously good invader

just let his W auto-switch to the closest monster if the original one dies

Except it wouldn't be too strong at all, because you still only get 3 damaging bounces if it bounces to him. This means that it will do at most half of the ability's total damage, where before you could proc the full damage on every camp except Gromp. (Which is why you smited Gromp even if you didn't want the passive)

Unless you're talking about boosting the damage of Drain by as much as 100% against isolated targets, it solves nothing. He gained an additional 55 seconds on his clear time with 6.22. Most other junglers actually clear faster now. Letting Drain switch from target to target would shave maybe 20 of those 55 seconds off.

The jungle changes nuked his clear speed. The buff camps losing their small minions means that he can't bounce his bird off of them, lowering his clear times for those camps. However, camps like the raptors and Krugs just have way too many small minions now, and he takes forever to actually clear them all.

What in particular do you think you're going to change about fervour and colossus? 

[ IMO fervour is in a pretty good spot. Mathe you want to have it stack faster for melees again, but I don't think it needs large buffs but Colossus could do with some changes. Maybe it should give more shield based on the number of enemies actually hit with cc, or perhaps increase the base by how many people are nearby (say base 5% increasing by .5% per enemy champion nearby keeps the max shield the same, but makes it more manageable in lane and in 1v1s). ]

Gut reaction is Courage is out of line in terms of both shield strength and CD, possible we just adjust one though.

Less sure on Fervor, does look like it's underperforming relative to Warlord's though. First step's probably to determine if it's too weak or Warlord's too strong as a result.

what seems to be the problems with Fervor IMO is that you can only stack it with autos. I tried it a few times on {{champion:28}} and it's just so underwhelming since it obviously favors ranged champs(not the only thing that does, but i digress) and i almost never had the AD when i needed it. The flat AD means that it should favor AD castors, but the casters can't get in enough autos to get the AD. very Auto heavy champs(more so ranged than melee) can easily stack fervor, but its much less useful on them and would much rather have Warlords(which casters can't use either(with few exceptions)).

Yep, almost certainly Rylai's in 6.24.

how do you decide how much to buff azir in 6.24 while nerfing one of his core items at the same time? Just genuinely curious, I figured you decided on what numbers are right based partly on live statistics

Azir buffs, at least in 6.24 or 7.1, are likely to be quite small. Azir's proven quite difficult to balance so we're really cautious of overdoing it and a nerf to Rylai's will affect a range of other champions as well. Playing it safe like that could certainly leave Azir in too poor a state still, especially if Rylai's is dramatically more important to him than other champs. If so we'd consider a second set of buffs.

Again, just to be clear on what we're thinking though, whatever we do for him's almost certainly small stuff, not major power impacting changes.
